com.facebook.react.bridge

Class ReactContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • com.facebook.react.bridge.ReactContext
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ReactApplicationContext, ThemedReactContext

    public class ReactContext
extends android.content.ContextWrapper
    Abstract ContextWrapper for Android application or activity Context and CatalystInstance

      • hasCurrentActivity

        public boolean hasCurrentActivity()

      • startActivityForResult

        public boolean startActivityForResult(android.content.Intent intent,
                                      int code,
                                      android.os.Bundle bundle)
        Same as Activity.startActivityForResult(Intent, int), this just redirects the call to the current activity. Returns whether the activity was started, as this might fail if this was called before the context is in the right state.

      • getCurrentActivity

        @Nullable
public android.app.Activity getCurrentActivity()
        Get the activity to which this context is currently attached, or null if not attached. DO NOT HOLD LONG-LIVED REFERENCES TO THE OBJECT RETURNED BY THIS METHOD, AS THIS WILL CAUSE MEMORY LEAKS.

      • getJavaScriptContextHolder

        public JavaScriptContextHolder getJavaScriptContextHolder()
        Get the C pointer (as a long) to the JavaScriptCore context associated with this instance. Use the following pattern to ensure that the JS context is not cleared while you are using it: JavaScriptContextHolder jsContext = reactContext.getJavaScriptContextHolder() synchronized(jsContext) { nativeThingNeedingJsContext(jsContext.get()); }
